review_title: Great team culture, unity, and mission
job_title: Support Team Coordinator in Dallas-Fort Worth
pros: The work we are doing to help end human trafficking is very meaningful. The senior leadership truly understands the value of people and make every effort to take care of their employees while keeping the mission of the organization a priority. The work they do around the world is tipping the scales of human trafficking in favor of the victims and making a global impact. Great work life balance.
cons: Overall organizational management can sometimes be a bit lacking. The organization lacks a career advancement pathways for employees looking have ways to grow move around from within.

pros: Reach people with valued information for protection the life.
cons: Organisation has core values and all of them are kept well.

pros: Actually making a difference in the fight against human trafficking. BEST culture and people to work with. Global organization with an incredible network and strategy.
cons: You'll find so much value in your work that you won't want to stop.

pros:
The mission is good. 
The global team is amazing.
cons:
The cause of the organization is solid, however, as an employee the hope of feeling valued and seen is just not in the cards. Leadership shows a lack of boundaries and manipulation plays a strong hand. 

Simply put, I wouldn't encourage anyone I know to work here.

pros: - autonomy regarding Project management - impactful job
cons: Management of tasks unrelated to the position description

pros: Loved learning from this team! You are part of changing the world
Great mission trying to change lives.
cons:
Spiritual manipulation from management - worked into the ground in the name of Christ.
No room for growth and development. 
Underpaid
Lack of policies and procedures
Misuse of funds

review_title: High impact work, very difficult working environment
pros:
Well resourced organisation
Well connected organisation (with government and non-profits)
Professional exterior
cons:
Manipulative management that bordered on being abusive
Highly punitive environment
Underpaid

review_title: An international, hardworking family with a hard-beating heart to fight slavery.
job_title: Lead Graphic Designer in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Amazing leaders. Core values intact. Supporting global work making a true difference.
cons: Doesn't have professional HR. Not ethnically diverse. No raises or bonuses ever discussed.

pros: AMAZING, loved what I got to be a part of

- I was entrusted with projects and empowered to run with them
- creative freedom
-staff outings
- opportunities to lead
cons: - occasionally demanding hours, outside of office hours
